post_text:
At MVA we want all our scholars to have access to resources that will make them successful not just for the school year but for life. In pursuit of this goal we have reached out to our local libraries and they have informed us of the opportunity for our students to get FREE TUTORING completely online. The link will be provided below. Please don't hesitate to take advantage of this resource!!

http://www.daytonmetrolibrary.org/research

post_text:
Moraine Parks and Recreation will be offering free bags of school supplies for three different age groups of children on August 10.

These bags will include some of the main school supplies your child will need for their upcoming school year. There will be a limited quantity of bags, and there will be three main age groups available: Preschool (3-5 years old), Youth (6-10 years old), and Teen (11-17 years old). The supplies provided are subject to change and are only available while supplies last.

You MUST register online to be eligible to receive a bag, and pickup will be on Monday, August 10th from 11:00am-1:00pm at the Payne Recreation Center (3800 Main Street, Moraine, Ohio 45439).…

post_text:
We are excited about the 2020-2021 school year at Miami Valley Academies and to share our excitement, we want to invite you to our Open House!!

In an effort to adhere to the social gathering and distancing guidelines, we will have Open House on two separate days:

Monday, August 17, 2020 - Scholars with the last names A-L will have their Open House from 4:00 pm - 5:00 pm.

Tuesday, August 18, 2020 - Scholars with the last name M-Z will have their Open House from 4:00 pm - 5:00 pm.

So that we can properly prepare for your arrival, we are asking all families to RSVP by, Friday, August 14, 2020 by 2:00 pm by calling the school at 937-294-4522.

We look forwarding in seeing you at our Open House and be looking out for your scholar’s welcome letter in the mail!
text:
We are excited about the 2020-2021 school year at Miami Valley Academies and to share our excitement, we want to invite you to our Open House!!

In an effort to adhere to the social gathering and distancing guidelines, we will have Open House on two separate days:

Monday, August 17, 2020 - Scholars with the last names A-L will have their Open House from 4:00 pm - 5:00 pm.

Tuesday, August 18, 2020 - Scholars with the last name M-Z will have their Open House from 4:00 pm - 5:00 pm.

So that we can properly prepare for your arrival, we are asking all families to RSVP by, Friday, August 14, 2020 by 2:00 pm by calling the school at 937-294-4522.

We look forwarding in seeing you at our Open House and be looking out for your scholar’s welcome letter in the mail!

Mr. Curry is out in the community meeting a need!

Every Monday from 11:30 am - 1:00 pm, we will be passing out food bags for our scholars, however if you or anyone in your family or community has a need to help supplement food for a young person throughout the week, feel free to stop by MVA located at 5656 N. Springboro Pike, Dayton OH 45449 on Mondays throughout the summer.

MVPs (Most Valuable Parents)

Next Monday and Tuesday, you can come to the school to pick up your scholar’s personal contents that were left in the building before we began our distance learning experience.

If you have a scholar in K-4, you will come to the school on Monday, May 18, 2020 from 10 am - 1 pm.

If you have a scholar in 5-8 grade, you will come to the school on Tuesday, May 19, 2020 from 10 am - 1 pm.

If you have any questions, feel free to contact us at the school at 937-294-4522

post_text: Cinco de Mayo, or Fifth of May, is an annual celebration to commemorate the Mexican Army’s victory over the French Empire at the Battle of Puebla, on May 5, 1862, under the leadership of General Ignacio Zaragoza.

post_text:
In an effort for staff and students to communicate more efficiently and effectively digitally, and to provide a more secure platform, we needed to change our student email addresses.

The only change to the new email address is that our scholars will have to place “-students” in their email address.

Example: ds1906@miamivalleyedu-students.org

Thank you for understanding and helping us provide a safe and engaging digital educational experience for all of our scholars and parents.
text:
In an effort for staff and students to communicate more efficiently and effectively digitally, and to provide a more secure platform, we needed to change our student email addresses.

The only change to the new email address is that our scholars will have to place “-students” in their email address.

Example: ds1906@miamivalleyedu-students.org

Thank you for understanding and helping us provide a safe and engaging digital educational experience for all of our scholars and parents.

post_text:
Miami Valley Academies’ online enrollment is now open!

If you are looking for a safe and welcoming environment, intimate and engaging class setting, caring and nurturing staff, and a school that has outperformed local school districts on the state test, Miami Valley Academies is an educational experience that you want to enroll your scholar up for!

Stop by our website and complete the enrollment form and once we receive your information, one of our caring staff members will reach out to you to share more about our school and answer any questions that you may have.

Enroll now, seats are limited!

https://www.miamivalleyedu.org/join

post_text:
Give your child the gift of education. At Miami Valley Academies, we are a K-8 community school whose mission is to provide a quality lifelong education based on individuality, opportunity, creativity, community pride, and belief in each person’s ability to learn.

We provide free breakfast and lunch, third-grade reading guarantee, extensive college credit plus program, opportunities for sports or club participation and more.

Enroll your child today to receive a specialized education!

shared_text:
Five Rivers MetroParks
June 15, 2019 at 1:00 PM ·

The 2nd Street Market and Five Rivers MetroParks are proud to partner with Dayton Inspires, Heart Mercantile, Living City Project and The Idea Collective as a collection site for the children’s Toy Drive, running through the afternoon of Monday, June 17.

We will be collecting toy donations on site for children, ages 3-17, who have been affected by the recent tornadoes. We appreciate the businesses mentioned above for putting together these initiatives and are proud to help serve the community with them!

Donations can be dropped off at the Market office, located in the far west side of the building.

We will be collecting toy donations on site for children, ages 3-17, who have been affected by the recent tornadoes. We appreciate the businesses mentioned above for putting together these initiatives and are proud to help serve the community with them!

Donations can be dropped off at the Market office, located in the far west side of the building.

post_text: Summer is here, but we are always preparing for the next school year! Please keep your immunizations up to date. For MVA specifically, we emphasize for those starting KG and those entering 7th grade. There are certain immunizations that you need in order to attend. Please see your pediatrician for a checkup to see if you need updates. post_text: Hello MVA friends- We were just informed that there is no Dayton Public bus running for MVA this afternoon. Parents of Dayton bus riders will have to come to the school to pick up your children. Thank you and we are sorry for the inconvenience.

post_text: Hello Parents! Picture retake day is coming soon on, November 14. If your child does not return with an order form slip stating you purchased online or was absent that day, your child’s picture will not be taken. If you have any questions please call the school at 937-294-4522.
text: Hello Parents! Picture retake day is coming soon on, November 14. If your child does not return with an order form slip stating you purchased online or was absent that day, your child’s picture will not be taken. If you have any questions please call the school at 937-294-4522.

post_text: Thank you to everyone who came out to our Trunk or Treat last Friday. This was a great event, thanks to all the volunteers and staff who helped make this an awesome night for the kids.
text: Thank you to everyone who came out to our Trunk or Treat last Friday. This was a great event, thanks to all the volunteers and staff who helped make this an awesome night for the kids.

post_text: Today is the day join us from 6-8 PM.

post_text: Join us tomorrow!

post_text: We are 9 days away from our Trunk or Treat. We still have room for organization to come a pass out candy or have an activity for the kids. Please comment below if you would like to participate. We are also accepting candy donations. You can drop off donations to Miami Valley Academies 5656 Springboro Pike, Dayton, OH 45449 by the 18th. Thank you and we hope to see you on the 19th.

post_text: We are doing great things at Miami Valley Academies, 5656 Springboro Pike, Moraine, Ohio. We want to send a big thanks to Crayons to Classrooms and The Dayton Foundation for featuring our wonderful second graders.
shared_text:
The Dayton Foundation
October 5, 2018 at 6:14 PM ·

Teachers spend hundreds of dollars out of their pockets to set up and stock up their classrooms with supplies for the school year.

Nearly ten years ago, a Dayton Foundation initiative to bring a teacher free store to Dayton became a reality. Today, Crayons to Classrooms helps teachers with students in need stock their classrooms for FREE.

Tag along as second grade teacher Ms. Brown shops for her classroom #WorldTeachersDay. 📚✏️🖍📏
